name: Singapore
description: Singapore, a sovereign city-state off the southern tip of the Malay Peninsula, is renowned for its stunning biodiversity, innovative urban planning, and vibrant cultural scene.  It’s a global hub for finance, technology, and trade, seamlessly blending modernity with lush greenery and a rich history.  The country’s strategic location and commitment to sustainability have shaped its unique identity.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Singapore boasts a diverse population comprising Chinese, Malay, Indian, and Eurasian communities.
quickFacts.detail: Multiculturalism is a cornerstone of Singaporean society, reflected in its cuisine, festivals, and traditions.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Singapore is one of the smallest countries in the world.
quickFacts.detail: Despite its size, it’s incredibly densely populated.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: SGD is pegged to the US dollar at a rate of 1:1.30.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Singapore has one of the highest GDPs per capita globally.
quickFacts.detail: It's a major player in global trade and finance.

quickFacts.label: Languages
quickFacts.detail: Other languages are widely spoken and recognized.

climateData.title: Tropical Rainforest Climate
climateData.description: Singapore experiences a tropical rainforest climate characterized by consistently high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, with distinct wet and dry seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season offers lower humidity and fewer rainfall days, making it ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings heavy rainfall, often in short, intense bursts. Despite the rain, the landscape remains lush and vibrant.

naturalWonders.name: Gardens by the Bay
naturalWonders.description: Gardens by the Bay is a stunning horticultural attraction featuring Supertrees, Cloud Forest, and Flower Dome. It showcases innovative sustainable design and a diverse collection of plants from around the world.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Supertrees are towering vertical gardens that light up at night, creating a spectacular display. The Cloud Forest replicates a cool-moist mountain environment, while the Flower Dome recreates a Mediterranean climate.
viewingTips: Visit at night to see the Supertrees illuminated.
Explore the different gardens at your own pace.

naturalWonders.name: Bukit Timah Nature Reserve
naturalWonders.description: Bukit Timah Nature Reserve is Singapore’s highest hill and a vital green lung within the city. It’s a haven for wildlife and offers challenging hiking trails.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The reserve is home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, including various bird species, reptiles, and insects. The summit provides panoramic views of the surrounding area.

naturalWonders.name: Pulau Ubin
naturalWonders.description: Pulau Ubin is a rustic island offering a glimpse into Singapore’s past. It’s a haven for wildlife and a popular destination for nature lovers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island is largely undeveloped, with traditional kampongs (villages) and a rich ecosystem. Visitors can explore the island by bicycle or boat.
viewingTips: Rent a bicycle to explore the island.

ecosystemData.title: Singapore’s Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Singapore’s diverse ecosystems range from urban green spaces to coastal wetlands and rainforest fragments. Conservation efforts are crucial to maintain the country’s rich biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Singapore is a birdwatcher’s paradise, attracting migratory species from around the world.

statistics.details: Various species migrate to Singapore during the winter months.
A wide variety of resident bird species thrive in Singapore's diverse habitats.

notableSpecies.name: Rostering Finfoot
notableSpecies.significance: A rare and beautiful wading bird.

notableSpecies.name: White Bellied Heron
notableSpecies.significance: A majestic bird found in coastal wetlands.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Life
biodiversityCategories.description: Singapore’s coastal waters are home to a diverse range of marine life, including coral reefs and various fish species.

statistics.details: Singapore’s coral reefs are facing challenges due to climate change and pollution.
A rich diversity of fish species inhabit Singapore’s waters.

notableSpecies.name: Lionfish
notableSpecies.significance: An invasive species that poses a threat to native fish populations.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Singapore
activities.description: Singapore offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Singapore’s natural trails and enjoy stunning views.

activities.name: Bukit Timah Summit Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Bukit Timah, Singapore’s highest hill.

activities.name: MacRitchie Reservoir Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail around MacRitchie Reservoir, offering opportunities for wildlife spotting.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Singapore’s beaches and coastal areas.

activities.name: Kayaking at Marina Bay
activities.description: Explore Marina Bay from a unique perspective by kayaking.

activities.name: Snorkeling at Pulau Hantu
activities.description: Discover the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of Pulau Hantu.
